timeline.message: Changed version of hapi fihr from v4.1 to v4.2
Changed to accept different service provider ids
Added part d events to the transformers
Part D event code to updated based on subscriberid
Added different getServiceProviderIdQualiferCode to part d

replies.bodyText: Lots of our URIs do. That's a separate issue, which we should backlog a tech debt ticket for. (Followed up on this in Slack.)

timeline.bodyText:
This won't quite work for our users. If you're going to use the https://terminology.hl7.org/1.0.0/CodeSystem-v2-0203.html codeset, then you have to use the codes from that codeset, too.
I'm having trouble figuring out how to type out a complete explanation, so perhaps we should chat about it on the phone next week? Dave may be able to help you with this, as well, if I get too tied up.
timeline.author: karlmdavis

timeline.message: Changed version of hapi fihr from v4.1 to v4.2
Changed to accept different service provider ids
Added part d events to the transformers
Part D event code to updated based on subscriberid
Added different getServiceProviderIdQualiferCode to part d
Merge branch 'cbrune/BFD-314-part-d-fields' of github.com:CMSgov/beneficiary-fhir-data into cbrune/BFD-314-part-d-fields
Changed to pass a serviceprovideridentifier enum to the create reference function in transformer utils
Changed test name for create reference
Changed response files back to whats in master

I guess it depends on how well/poorly that ends up impacting other uses of TransformerUtils.createIdentifierReference(...)...

timeline.bodyText: There should really just be one CODING_SYSTEM_... constant per codesystem (not per code), so I'd remove this constant and refer to the other one, instead.

replies.bodyText:
See the below link for more details. This is a licensed and standard identifier system maintained by NCPDP. CARIN refers to it too.
http://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-rtpbc/2020Feb/NamingSystem-carin-rtpbc-NamingSystem-ncpdp-provider-id.html
replies.author: dshekhar18

replies.bodyText: Then, @cthayes, the link that @dshekhar18 provided should 💯  be in the comment on this constant.

timeline.bodyText: Not a big deal, but I don't think that {@link Identifier#getServiceProviderIdentifiers()} is legit, is it?
timeline.author: karlmdavis

timeline.bodyText:
Why is providerIdentifiers a vararg (why does it allow for zero to many entries)?
If you're just trying to avoid the need to refactor other uses of it, please don't -- this just adds to tech debt, overall, as your code below only supports zero-or-one providerIdentifiers, which puts the lie to the method signature. Instead, bite the bullet and make it an Optional<...>. If you really want to avoid the extra refactoring, you can always add an overloaded version of this method without the new parameter.
timeline.author: karlmdavis

replies.bodyText: Yea i just made an overloaded function with IdentifierType and IdentifierValue as params
replies.author: cbrunefearless

timeline.bodyText: I'd suggest adding JavaDoc for this method to make it clearer what it does. Also: you should probably fix the case on its params, so that they don't look like types.

timeline.bodyText:
Yeah, I thought about suggesting you move the constants here, but wasn't 💯  on it. On the one hand, it's nice to have all the custom codesets in one place to inspect them. On the other, I'm not a fan of the indirection it adds.
Anywhoways, entirely your call on what the better choice is: here or the enum. (I guess if you wanted to put them in the enum you could drop a comment here pointing to it. 🤷 )
timeline.author: karlmdavis
